answers.author: Eric Norenberg
answers.text:
The City of Oberlin has tried to do a series of simple events to connect with employees, recognize and celebrate accomplishments in a less formal setting this year.  We've tried to rotate the locations and responsibilities amongst different departments.  So far, the Finance Dept. hosted an ice cream social and we've held a chili cook-off coordinated by maintenance.  Coming up: employee-only, behind the scenes tour of  the renovated water treatment plant.  Great opportunities for staff to network at different sites.

answers.author: Leslie Beauregard
answers.text:
FY 2011 is the second year we have not been able to provide raises to employees - so we have done various activities such as field days at area parks (fun activities for employees that occur during the workday) and free lunch as part of Government Services Day.

author: Zane Reynolds
text:
With recent budget reductions and cuts in staff, moral within the office and amongst municipal staff may be relatively low. 
Have you held any special activities to help boost moral amongst your staff?
Have you planned any activities to help staff reconnect with each other?
Have you attended a local sporting event?
Are you concerned with the community perception of the municipality attending such events?
title: Reconnecting with Staff
